text.0: i laud the heroes twain this heavens controllers singing with songs of praise i call the aśvins.
text.1: fain in a moment when the morns are breaking to part the earths ends and the spacious regions.
text.2: moving to sacrifice through realms of lustre they light the radiance of the car that bears them.
text.3: traversing many wide unmeasured spaces over the wastes ye pass and fields and waters.
text.4: ye to that bounteous path of yours ye mighty have ever borne away our thoughts with horses.
text.5: mindswift and full of vigour that the trouble of man who offers gifts might cease and slumber.
text.6: so ye when ye have yoked your chariothorses come to the hymn of the most recent singer.
text.7: our true and ancient herald priest shall bring you the youthful bearing splendour food and vigour.
text.8: with newest hymn i call those wonderworkers ancient and brilliant and exceeding mighty.
text.9: bringers of bliss to him who lauds and praises bestowing varied bounties on the singer.
text.10: so ye with birds out of the sea and waters bore bhujyu son of tugra through the regions.
text.11: speeding with winged steeds through dustless spaces out of the bosom of the flood they bore him.
text.12: victors carborne ye rent the rock asunder bulls heard the calling of the eunuchs consort.
text.13: bounteous ye filled the cow with milk for Śayu thus swift and zealous ones ye showed your favour.
text.14: whateer from olden time heaven earth existeth great object of the wrath of gods and mortals.
text.15: make that Ādityas vasus sons of rudra an evil brand to one allied with demons.
text.16: may he who knows as varuṇa and mitra airs realm appointing both the kings in season.
text.17: against the secret fiend cast forth his weapon against the lying words that strangers utter.
text.18: come to our home with friendly wheels for offipring come on your radiant chariot rich in heroes.
text.19: strike off ye twain the heads of our assailants who with mans treacherous attack approach us.
text.20: come hitherward to us with teams of horses the highest and the midmost and the lowest.
text.21: bountiful lords throw open to the singer doors een of the firmclosed stall of cattle.
